data.name: AuswerteGeraet
data.value: Englisch

data.name: Hilfe_Beschaffenheitspruefung
data.value:
This inspection applies to the in-process control of all weighing instruments that are assembled or modified by RHEWA personnel or on our behalf by authorised representatives integrated in the RHEWA QM system.
The responsible or authorised employee shall check the criteria listed below in full.
A part is non-conforming if a characteristic is out of specification. If the number of non-conforming parts equals 0, the weighing instruments are released for verification. If the number of non-conforming parts is greater than 0, the parts are segregated and corrective action is taken. They may not be released for verification until they have been re-inspected and approved.
note:
1. the verification processes has been carried out in accordance to EN 45501 Nr. 3.5.3.1 und 3.9.2.1 ff. 2. the customer is responsible for the subsequent verification 3. The measurement is performed by compensation with reference standards which are calibrated by an accredited test laboratory or office of weights and measures which are traceable to measurement standards. 4. performed by standard weights accuracy class M1. 5. Any load cell(s) may be used for instruments under this EC type approval certificate, provided the following conditions are met: - There is a respective OIML Certificate of Conformity (R60) or a test certificat (EN45501) issued for the load cell by a Notified Body responsible for types examination under Directive 2009/23/EG. - The certificate contains the loadcell types and the necessary load cell data required for the manufacturer's declaration of compatibility of modules (WELMEC 2, issue 2, 1996, No11), and any particular installation requirements. A load cell marked NH is allowed only (WELMEC 2, Ausgabe4, 2004, Nr.11) if humidity testing to EN45501 has been conducted on this load cell. - The compatibility of load cells and indicator is established by the manufacturer by means of the compatibility of modules from, contained in the above WELMEC 2 document, at the time of EC verification or declaration of EC conformity of type - The load transmission must conform to one of the examples shown in the WELMEC guide for load cells (WELMEC 2.4).

data.name: Hilfe_Hauptmenue
data.value: Englisch

data.name: Hilfe_KompatiblitaetsnachweisErgebnisHilfe
data.value: Englisch

data.name: Hilfe_KompatiblitaetsnachweisHilfe
data.value: Englisch

data.name: Hilfe_Kompatiblitaetsnachweis_AWGAnschlussart
data.value:
cable connection (4- or 6-wire) between load cell junction box and indicator
The original 4-wire load cell cable have to be kept in any case,
The connection of original 4-wire load cell cables just beside the indicator is also allowed in any case

data.name: Hilfe_Kompatiblitaetsnachweis_AWGBruchteilEichfehlergrenze
data.value: fraction of the maximum permissible error of the weighing instrument used for the indicator according to R76 No 3.5.4 standard pind = 0,5 ; allowable 0,3 > pind > 0,8

data.name: Hilfe_Kompatiblitaetsnachweis_AWGGrenzwerteLastwiderstandMax
data.value: upper limit of the impedance for the load cell(s) to be supplied (limitted by sensitivity against EMC) Indicator 83N ges.5000 Ohm Indicator 83+ ges.5000 Ohm Indicator 83Z ges.5000 Ohm Indicator 84 ges.5000 Ohm Indicator 82a ges.3300 Ohm Indicator 82b,c,e ges.5250 Ohm

data.name: Hilfe_Kompatiblitaetsnachweis_AWGGrenzwerteLastwiderstandMin
data.value:
lower limit of the impedance of the load cell(s) to be supplied the load cells are connected in parallel (limitted by power supply fittted by the indicator)
Indicator 83 N ges. 87 Ohm Indicator 83 plus ges. 87 Ohm Indicator 83 Z ges. 35 Ohm Indicator 84 ges. 44 Ohm Indicator 82a ges. 50 Ohm Indicator 82b,c,e ges. 40 Ohm

data.name: Hilfe_Kompatiblitaetsnachweis_AWGKabellaenge
data.value:
Maximal allowed ratio of cable length per wire cross section
Indicator 83 N 116 m/mm² Indicator 83 plus 116 m/mm² Indicator 83Z 440 m/mm² Indicator 84 110 m/mm² Indicator 82a 750 m/mm² Indicator 82b,c,e 54,2 m/mm²
see comment to cross section of wire A

data.name: Hilfe_Kompatiblitaetsnachweis_AWGKlasse
data.value:
Accuracy class:
The accuracy classes of NAWI, Ind and LCs are compatible, if they follow table below:

NAWI I II III IIII
Ind I I*), II II*), III III, IIII
LC A A*), B B*), C C, D

*) at sufficient temperature range and evaluation of stability against
humidity and creep correspond to requirement in the lower
(more accurate) class

data.name: Hilfe_Kompatiblitaetsnachweis_AWGMindesteingangsspannung
data.value:
the indicator may need a minimum input voltage at all (bias), if so the value is given in the indicator documentation; this indicator is not able to measure changing polarity of voltage
If no Umin is required insert 0

data.name: Hilfe_Kompatiblitaetsnachweis_AWGMindestmesssignal
data.value:
The minimum value allowed for the signal voltage per verification scale interval is:
Indicator 83N 0,5üV/ e Indicator 83+ 0,5 üV/ e Indicator 83Z 0,6 üV/ e Indicator 84 0,7 üV/ e Indicator 82a 0,5 üV/ e Indicator 82b,c,e 0,3 üV/ e

data.name: Hilfe_Kompatiblitaetsnachweis_AWGSpeisespannung
data.value:
Excitation power supply for the load cell(s)
Indicator 83N 8V Indicator 83+ 8V Indicator 84 8V Indicator 83Z 12V Indicator 82a,b,c,e 5V
Note: Insert total voltage, wrong + 5 V correct 10 V
Further see comment for cross section A

data.name: Hilfe_Kompatiblitaetsnachweis_AWGTeilungswerte
data.value:
maximal number of verification scale intervals for the indicator:
single -range/interval multi -range/interval accuracy- class III IV III IV Gerät 83+/83Z/84 10000 1000 3000 1000 82a,b,c,e 10000 1000 6000 1000
maximum of 3 partial ranges
The maximal number n ind of verification scale intervals of the indicator must be equal or better than the number of verification scale intervals of the weighing instrument n = Max/e. For multiple range and muti-interval weighing instruments this must be met for every weighing range.

data.name: Hilfe_Kompatiblitaetsnachweis_AWGTemperaturbereichMax
data.value: limit of the temperature range upper limit of the environment temperature for the indicator

data.name: Hilfe_Kompatiblitaetsnachweis_AWGTemperaturbereichMin
data.value: limit of the temperature range lower limit of the environment temperature for the indicator

data.name: Hilfe_Kompatiblitaetsnachweis_WaageEinschaltnullstellbereich
data.value:
Function for setting the indication to zero at
the time the indicator is switched on.
Standard setting Rhewa:
15% upper limit for permissible initial zero setting

3kg = 0,450kg
6kg = 0,900kg
15kg = 2,250kg
30kg = 4,5kg
60kg = 9,0kg
150kg = 22,5kg
300kg = 45kg
600kg = 90kg
1500kg = 225kg
3000kg = 450kg
6000kg = 900kg
15000kg = 2250kg

data.name: Hilfe_Kompatiblitaetsnachweis_VerbindungselementeBruchteilEichfehlergrenze
data.value:
fraction of the maximum permissible error of the weighing instrument applied for connecting elements pcon , For the fraction of all unknown mechanical and electrical connection elements between load receptor, load cell(s) a d indicator.
acceptable according to R76 No 3.4.5 pcon = 0,5

data.name: Hilfe_Kompatiblitaetsnachweis_WaageAdditiveTarahoechstlast
data.value:
maximum value of the additive tare device (if existing)
if no device of Additive Tare, fill out with 0

data.name: Hilfe_Kompatiblitaetsnachweis_WaageAnzahlWaegezellen
data.value: number of load cells

data.name: Hilfe_Kompatiblitaetsnachweis_WaageEcklastzuschlag
data.value:
factor NUD: (WI = weighing instrument, LC = load cell)

Factor for Non Uniform Distributed load caused by excentric loading,
NUD shall prohibit that a load cell is applied with load outside of the garanteed measuring range.

According to WELMEC 2 (Issue 3) Nr. 3.1.6.6 followig values may be accepted for NUD:
- WIs with lever work and with one LC, WIs with one single point LC and
WIs with load receptors which allöw only minimal eccentric load application
(eg hopper scales, but without shaker on the receptor ) 0 % Max

- other conventional instruments : 20 % Max

- over head track scales, fork lift scales and weighbridges : 50 % Max

- Multi-platform WIs with more than one load receptor
fix combined 50 % Max (total)
variable selection or combined 50 % Max (of single platform)

data.name: Hilfe_Kompatiblitaetsnachweis_WaageEichwert
data.value: Maximum capacity of One range weighing instrument

data.name: Hilfe_Kompatiblitaetsnachweis_WaageEichwert1
data.value: verification interval of the lower weighing range of a multiple range or multi-interval weighing instrument

data.name: Hilfe_Kompatiblitaetsnachweis_WaageEichwert2
data.value: verification interval of the 2nd weighing range of multiple range or multi-interval weighing instrument (e 1 = smallest weighing range)

data.name: Hilfe_Kompatiblitaetsnachweis_WaageEichwert3
data.value: verification interval of the upper weighing range of multi-interval weighing instrument (e1 = smallest verification interval)

data.name: Hilfe_Kompatiblitaetsnachweis_WaageHoechstlast
data.value: verification interval of One range weighing instrument

data.name: Hilfe_Kompatiblitaetsnachweis_WaageHoechstlast1
data.value: Maximum capacity of the lower weighing range of multiple range or multi-interval weighing instrument

data.name: Hilfe_Kompatiblitaetsnachweis_WaageHoechstlast2
data.value: Maximum capacity of the 2nd weighing range of multipe range or multi-interval weighing instruments (Max1 = lower weighing range)

data.name: Hilfe_Kompatiblitaetsnachweis_WaageHoechstlast3
data.value: Maximum capacity of the upper weighing range of multiple range or multi-interval weighing instruments (Max1 = lower weighing range)

data.name: Hilfe_Kompatiblitaetsnachweis_WaageKabellaenge
data.value: length of cable length of cable between indicator and load cell junction box ( load cell cables themselves have to maintain original)

data.name: Hilfe_Kompatiblitaetsnachweis_WaageKabelquerschnitt
data.value:
cross section of wire cross section of one wire from cable (4 or 6 wires) between indicator and load cell junction box
Note - By application of different cross sections in one cable use for 4-wires the supply wires for 6-wires the reference wires - Using flash protection elements, the exitation voltage at the load cell has to be checked when applying check on condition (8)

data.name: Hilfe_Kompatiblitaetsnachweis_WaageKlasse
data.value:
Accuracy class:
The accuracy classes of NAWI, Ind and LCs are compatible, if they follow table below:

NAWI I II III IIII
Ind I I*), II II*), III III, IIII
LC A A*), B B*), C C, D

*) at sufficient temperature range and evaluation of stability against
humidity and creep corresponds to requirement in the lower
(more accurate) class

data.name: Hilfe_Kompatiblitaetsnachweis_WaageTemperaturbereichMAX
data.value: limit of the temperature range upper limit of the environment temperature for the whole weighing instrument

data.name: Hilfe_Kompatiblitaetsnachweis_WaageTemperaturbereichMin
data.value: limit of the temperature range lower limit of the environment temperature for the whole weighing instrument

data.name: Hilfe_Kompatiblitaetsnachweis_WaageTotlast
data.value: dead load: weight of the load receptor and additionally mounted constructions on the load receptor

data.name: Hilfe_Kompatiblitaetsnachweis_WaageUebersetzungsverhaeltnis
data.value:
reduction ratio R The reduction ratio is given by a lever work system.
According to R76 No T.3.3 R = (Force onto the load cell)/(Gravitation force onto the load receptor)
Using lever works normally the number N of load cells is N = 1 and R < 1 The value of R has to be given by the WI-manufacturer Without lever system the reduction ratio R always will be R = 1
Format of Field: Number Excample of wrong format 1:4, inputs with ":" will be treated as time correct format 1/4 or 0,25

data.name: Hilfe_Kompatiblitaetsnachweis_WZBruchteilEichfehlergrenze
data.value: fraction of the maximum permissible error of the weighing instrument applied for the load cells if not indicated in the test certificate , pLC = 0,7.

data.name: Hilfe_Kompatiblitaetsnachweis_WZGenauigkeitsklasse
data.value:
Accuracy class:
The accuracy classes of NAWI, Ind and LCs are compatible, if they follow table below:

NAWI I II III IIII
Ind I I*), II II*), III III, IIII
LC A A*), B B*), C C, D

*) at sufficient temperature range and evaluation of stability against
humidity and creep correspond to requirement in the lower
(more accurate) class

data.name: Hilfe_Kompatiblitaetsnachweis_WZHoechstlast
data.value:
maximum capacity of one load cell
The maximum capacity of the load cell shall not be exeeded when applying Max on the weighing instrument.
capacity
Kg N lb
20,4 200
51 500
91 200
102 1000
204 2000
227 500
454 1000
510 5000
1020 10000
1134 2500
2039 20000
2268 5000

10197 100000

34020 75000
45360 100000

data.name: Hilfe_Kompatiblitaetsnachweis_WZHoechstteilungsfaktor
data.value:
ratio of Emax / vmin of the load cell
If Y or vmin is not indicated (f.e. in the test certificate), nLC will be used instead of Y .

data.name: Hilfe_Kompatiblitaetsnachweis_WZKriechteilungsfaktor
data.value: ratio of Emax / 2* DR of the load cell Where DR or Z not known (f.e. not indicated in the test certificate), nLC will be used instead of Z.

data.name: Hilfe_Kompatiblitaetsnachweis_WZMaxTeilungswerte
data.value: maximal number of verification scale intervals of the load cell: The max. number nLC of verification scale intervals of the load cell must be equal or better than the number of verification scale intervals of the weighing instrument n = Max/e. For multiple range and muti-interval weighing instruments this must be met for every weighing range.

data.name: Hilfe_Kompatiblitaetsnachweis_WZMindestvorlast
data.value:
minimum dead load of one load cell
the applied dead load on the load cell in the WI must be bigger or equal to the minimum dead load of the load cell
when Emin = 0 insert 0

data.name: Hilfe_Kompatiblitaetsnachweis_WZMinTeilungswert
data.value: smallest verification interval of one load cell If Y or vmin is not indicated (f.e. in the test certificate), nLC will be used instead of Y .

data.name: Hilfe_Kompatiblitaetsnachweis_WZRueckkehrVorlastsignal
data.value: minimum dead load return of the load cell: Where DR or Z not known (f.e. not indicated in the test certificate), nLC will be used instead of Z.

data.name: Hilfe_Kompatiblitaetsnachweis_WZTemperaturbereichMIN
data.value: limit of the temperature range lower limit of the environment temperature for the load cell

data.name: Hilfe_Kompatiblitaetsnachweis_WZWaegezellenkennwert
data.value: rated output of the load cell when loading with maximum capacity (in mV/V)

data.name: Hilfe_Kompatiblitaetsnachweis_WZWiderstand
data.value:
Input impedance of one load cell:
The WI may have N load cells. The smallest ratio of RLC / N is limitted by the power supply of the indicator

data.name: Hilfe_Kompatiblitaetsnachweis_WZTemperaturbereichMAX
data.value: limit of the temperature range upper limit of the environment temperature for the load cell

data.name: Hilfe_Nullstellung
data.value:
4.5.2 Accuracy
After zero setting the effect of zero deviation on the result of the weighing shall be not more than ± 0.25 e.

A.4.2.3 Accuracy of zero-setting (4.5.2)
The test may be combined with A.4.4.1.

A.4.2.3.1 Non-automatic and semi-automatic zero-setting
The accuracy of the zero-setting device is tested by first loading the instrument to an indication as close as possible to a changeover point, and then by initiating the zero-setting device and determining the additional load at which the indication changes from zero to one scale interval above zero. The error at zero is calculated according to the description in A.4.4.3.

A.4.2.3.2 Automatic zero-setting or zero-tracking
The indication is brought out of the automatic range (e.g. by loading with 10 e). Then the additional load at which the indication changes from one scale interval to the next above is determined and the error is calculated according to the description in A.4.4.3. It is assumed that the error at zero load would be equal to the error at the load in question.

data.name: Hilfe_PruefungWiederholbarkeitStaffelverfahren
data.value:
Determine the allowed number of substitutions according to EN 45501 3.7.3.
If the repeatability error is not greater than 0.2 e, this portion may be reduced to 1/5 Max. If the repeatability error is not greater than 0.35 e, the portion of standard weights may be reduced to 1/3 Max. If the repeatability error is greater than 0.35 e, the portion of standard weights must 50%
